title: PR / Media Director Job at Choice Talents NG
content:
Choice Talents NG is Nigeria’s preferred talents management company. Our goal is to help build successful businesses through effective talent, resource and process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: PR / Media Director

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Job


	We are looking for a very senior editor well experienced with print, radio and TV media, to manage the public relations responsibilities of an international NGO.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and maintain strong relationships with key media outlets, journalists, and influencers to secure positive press coverage.
	Draft and distribute press releases, media advisories, and pitch materials.
	Respond to media inquiries and coordinate media interviews with company spokespeople.
	Work with senior leadership to develop and execute PR strategies that align with the company’s goals and objectives.
	Act as the company’s spokesperson during a crisis, providing clear, timely, and accurate information to the media.
	Write press releases, articles, speeches, blog posts, op-eds, articles, and other communication materials as needed.
	Oversee the creation of compelling, media-friendly content, ensuring alignment with objectives.
	Establish and maintain a clear and consistent voice for the brand across all communication channels.
	Provide strategic counsel to executives on media interactions and public appearances.
	Develop and implement crisis communication plans and manage communication during sensitive or critical situations.
	Plan and coordinate press events, conferences, and other public relations activities.
	Represent the organization at industry events, media interviews, and public speaking engagements.
	Track media coverage and report on the effectiveness of PR campaigns and media outreach.
	Analyze trends in media coverage and public opinion to adapt strategies and improve outcomes.
	Lead and mentor junior PR team members, providing guidance and support in their professional development.
	Collaborate with marketing, social media, and other internal teams to ensure cohesive and effective communication strategies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Public Relations, Communications, Journalism, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
	15+ years of experience in public relations, with a focus on media relations and corporate communications.
	Proven track record of developing and executing successful PR campaigns and securing positive media coverage.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling narratives.
	Strong media relationships with local, national, and trade press.
	Experience in crisis communication and handling sensitive issues.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: jobs@choicetalents.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Virtual Assistant Job at Design Synchrony
content:
Design Synchrony is a dynamic software development, graphic design, and printing company. We offer top-notch services in website design, mobile app development, printing, and branding, and we are on a mission to expand our online presence and grow our business. We're looking for a talented Social Media & Digital Marketing Manager to join our team and drive our marketing efforts across social media, freelancing platforms, SEO, influencer collaborations, and WhatsApp engagement.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Virtual Assistant

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design Synchrony is seeking a detail-oriented, proactive, and organized Office Assistant to join our dynamic team.
	This is a hybrid role, requiring both in-office and remote work.
	The ideal candidate will support the day-to-day administrative operations, assist with office management, and ensure smooth functioning of office processes while collaborating with our team.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage office supplies and inventory, ensuring a well-stocked and organized office.
	Assist in scheduling meetings, coordinating travel arrangements, and managing calendars.
	Assist with organizing and preparing documents, presentations, and reports.
	Provide general administrative support to the team as required.
	Handle incoming calls, emails, and other communications in a professional manner.
	Perform data entry and maintain accurate office records.
	Ensure the office environment is clean, safe, and conducive to productivity.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a relevant qualification
	Proven experience as an office assistant, administrative assistant, or in a similar role.
	Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
	Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
	A proactive attitude and strong attention to detail.
	Prior experience in managing office supplies and administrative tasks is a plus.
	Applicant must reside in Shomolu or be within a walkable distance of Shomolu, Lagos.


Salary
N50,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a Cover Letter to: recruitment@designsynchrony.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: CNG Instrument Engineer Job at Dangote Group
content:
Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: CNG Instrument Engineer
Job Location: Zaria, Kaduna / Port-Harcourt, Rivers / Obajana, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are  seeking for skilled CNG Instrument Engineer to join our dynamic team. The position will require an in-depth understanding of instrumentation within the construction industry, particularly related to compressed natural gas (CNG) systems.


Responsibilities


	Design, develop and implement instrumentation systems for CNG utilization.
	Conduct regular maintenance and calibration of instrumentation equipment.
	Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure seamless integration of CNG systems into ongoing projects.
	Prepare technical documentation and reports for instrumentation systems.
	Monitor and troubleshoot instrumentation issues in real-time during operations.
	Ensure compliance with industry standards and safety regulations.
	Provide training and support to site staff on CNG instrumentation and controls.


 Requirements


	Bachelors degree in Instrumentation Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in instrumentation engineering within the construction or manufacturing industry.
	Proven experience in instrumentation design, calibration, installation, and Maintenance 
	Proficient in the use of instrumentation software and tools.
	Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.

title: Logistics Coordinator Job at Dangote Group
content:
Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Coordinator
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Logistics Coordinator to oversee and manage the movement of polypropylene.
	This role involves coordinating with shipping companies, port operators, internal teams, and service providers to ensure the efficient, compliant, and timely transportation of goods.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of domestic logistics, container operations, customer documentation, and Nigerian import/export procedures.


Key Duties & Responsibilities


	Coordinate inbound and outbound logistics for polypropylene containers to and from Dangote Refinery.
	Liaise with ports (Lekki Port, Apapa Port), clearing agents, and transport service providers to ensure timely container movements.
	Track and monitor shipments to avoid demurrage or detention costs.
	Prepare, verify, and manage all shipping and delivery documentation including manifests, invoices, delivery notes, and customer-required paperwork.
	Maintain accurate records of logistics activities and submit regular reports to the Supply Chain Manager.
	Collaborate with internal teams (Production, Sales, Finance) to plan and forecast container dispatches and deliveries.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian import/export regulations and company policies.
	Troubleshoot logistics issues and proactively manage any delays or disruptions.
	Manage logistics KPIs and drive continuous improvement initiatives.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	3–5 years of relevant logistics or supply chain experience, preferably in petrochemicals, manufacturing, or containerized cargo.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian port operations (Apapa, Lekki) and domestic transport networks.
	Experience coordinating container haulage from ports to industrial sites and vice versa.
	Familiarity with customs procedures, import/export documentation, and shipping regulations.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; ERP or logistics software knowledge is a plus.
	Understanding of HSE (Health, Safety, Environment) practices in logistics.


Key attributes:


	Excellent coordination and organizational skills.
	Strong communication and negotiation abilities.
	Proactive problem-solver with a high sense of accountability.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.
	Attention to detail and commitment to compliance.
